title: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor.
OB:
When performing the following steps:
1) Opening an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder "Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets" in the project "org.eclipse.swt" in the open source repository.
2) Selecting the end of the first line and adding a space character to mark the file as dirty.

After this, on my (fast) machine at home, it takes about 8 seconds to perform the following steps:
3) Clicking on the close box in the editor tab.
4) Answering "no" to the "do you want to save changes" dialog.
5) Double-clicking on the file in the navigator to reopen it.

However, if I repeat steps 1) and 2), and then select "Revert" from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: The time taken to perform the "Revert" action from the pop-up menu in the editor should be similar to the time taken to close the editor, answer "no" to the save changes dialog, and reopen the file from the navigator.
SR:
1) Open an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder "Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets" in the project "org.eclipse.swt" in the open source repository.
2) Select the end of the first line and add a space character to mark the file as dirty.
3) Click on the close box in the editor tab.
4) When prompted with the "do you want to save changes" dialog, click on "no".
5) Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
6) Repeat steps 1) and 2).
7) Right-click on the editor to open the pop-up menu.
8) Select "Revert" from the pop-up menu.

Note: Observe the time taken for the "Revert" action compared to the time taken for closing the editor and reopening the file.
